newsitem.title: CANADA: Rayrock says plans share buyback.
newsitem.headline: Rayrock says plans share buyback.

text.p: Rayrock Yellowknife Resources Inc said on Friday it will make a normal course issuer bid for up to 1.58 million of its subordinate voting shares.
A notice of intention to make the bid was accepted by the Toronto Stock Exchange, Rayrock said in a statement.
The proposed share buyback represents about 10 percent of the company's issued and outstanding subordinate voting shares.
"In the opinion of the company's management, the value of the subordinate voting shares exceeds their current trading price," Rayrock Chief Executive Officer David Crombie said in a statement.
Under the bid, the company can buy shares any time between May 27, 1997 and May 26, 1998.
Rayrock's stock rose 0.30 to 6.95 on the Toronto Stock Exchange on Friday.
